comment: He's very disciplined in his professional work and that comes out in his teaching. He expects a lot, but it's because he wants to make you better. He will push you when you need to be pushed and he will lay off when he sees your passionate about spending time with your design. If you respect his level of passion for architecture, you will succeed.

Heavy course load in studio, but focused in areas that don't apply to final deliverables. Highly knowledgeable, but can be a bit condescending. He is helpful in desk critiques, but in reviews brings up issues that he didn't address beforehand. Focuses heavily on surrounding area, leaving little time for actual building development.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: He is an intelligent professor, and pushes you to do your absolute best. He does play favoritism, and clings on to a "favorite" student and treats them differently from the rest of the class. Overall you'll learn a lot, and his studio was extremely hard but helpful. I just wish he treated everyone the same.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Great knowledge of building systems and technical details, but little care or concern for his students. He ironically propagates a corporate capitalistic teaching model (with endless work and soul-crushing reviews) while preaching sustainability and green practices. He has called students "pathetic." I respect his knowledge, but not his character.
Excellent professor, extremely helpful, he can teach you a lot

Very clear, basically a walking textbook of architecture. You will work very hard in his class, however, you will come out knowing alot. Also the only teacher that breaks down your grade into great detail
